{{also|Haben}} ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|de|ham||in informal writing}} * {{alter|de|han||archaic|dialectal}} ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|de|kehâ‚‚p}} From {{inh|de|gmh|haben}}, from {{inh|de|goh|habÄ“n}} (Akin to {{cog|osx|hebbian}}, {{cog|non|hafa}} ({{cog|sv|hava}}/{{m|sv|ha}}), {{cog|ofs|habba}}, {{cog|got|ğŒ·ğŒ°ğŒ±ğŒ°ğŒ½}}, {{cog|ang|habban}}), from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*habjanÄ…}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*kehâ‚‚p-||to grasp}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|hebben}}, {{cog|en|have}}, {{cog|da|have}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ËˆhaËbÉ™n/|[ËˆhaËbÉ™n]|[ËˆhaËbmÌ©]}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/ham/}} {{a|common; particularly in the present tense, occasionally also in the infinitive}} {{attn|de|[hamÌ©] ?}} * {{audio|de|De-haben.ogg|audio}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-irregular|hat|hatte|gehabt|past subjunctive=hÃ¤tte}} # {{lb|de|auxiliary|with a past participle}} to [[have]] ({{non-gloss definition|forms the [[perfect tense|perfect]] and [[past perfect|past perfect tense]]}}) # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[have]]; to [[own]] {{gloss|to possess, have ownership of; to possess a certain characteristic}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[have]]; to [[hold]] {{gloss|to contain within itself/oneself}} #: {{ux|de|Glaub und '''hab''' keine Angst.|Believe and don't be afraid ''or'' Believe and '''have''' no fear.}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[have]], [[get]] {{gloss|to obtain, acquire}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[get]] {{gloss|to receive}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[have]] {{gloss|to be scheduled to attend}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[have]] {{gloss|to be afflicted with, suffer from}} # {{lb|de|transitive|of units of measure}} to [[contain]], be [[compose]]d of, [[equal]] #: {{ux|de|Ein Meter '''hat''' 100 Zentimeter.|There are 100 centimetres in one metre.|lit=One metre '''has''' 100 centimetres.}} # {{lb|de|impersonal|dialectal|with ''[[es]]''}} [[there be]], [[there is]], [[there are]] #: {{ux|de|Es '''hat''' zwei BÃ¼cher.|There are two books.}} # {{lb|de|reflexive|colloquial}} to [[make]] a [[fuss]] #: {{ux|de|'''Hab''' dich nicht so!|Don't make such a fuss!}} # {{lb|de|colloquial|with {{m|de|es}} and {{m|de|mit}}}} to be [[occupied]] with, to [[like]] #: {{ux|de|Ich '''hab''''s nich so mit Hunden.|I'm not a great fan of dogs.|lit=I don't '''have''' it that much with dogs.}} ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|hab|hat|gehabt|h||ha|hÃ¤t||||a}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4 |de|anhaben |Habe |Haben |haben kÃ¶nnen |Habgier |habhaft |hÃ¤big |Habseligkeit |Habsucht |vorhaben }} ---- ==Middle English== ===Verb=== {{head|enm|verb}} # {{alt form|enm|haven|id=to have|t=to have}} ---- ==Old High German== ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|goh|kehâ‚‚p}} From {{inh|goh|gem-pro|*habjanÄ…}}, whence also {{cog|osx|hebbian}}, {{cog|ang|habban}}, {{cog|non|hafa}}, {{cog|got|ğŒ·ğŒ°ğŒ±ğŒ°ğŒ½}}.
